title: Welcome to My Tech Portfolio
text:
Hello! I‚Äôm Xu Haiyang, a Computer Science graduate specializing in Cybersecurity & Cyber-Physical Systems. This website serves as a portfolio to showcase my projects, research, and technical knowledge in IoT, Cybersecurity, AWS Cloud, and AI.



Education:

Singapore Management University (Aug 2021 ‚Äì Dec 2024) - BSc in Computer Science (Cybersecurity & CPS)
Singapore Polytechnic (Mar 2018 ‚Äì Apr 2021) - Diploma in Computer Engineering

Certifications: AWS Certified Solutions Architect
Programming Skills: Java, C/C++, Python, JavaScript, ReactJS
Cybersecurity Skills: OWASP ZAP, SQL Injection Testing, IAM, Risk Management, Threat Intelligence




This website is structured into several sections to help visitors and myself find useful solutions: - Cyber Defense & Threat Intelligence: Articles and resources on security best practices, penetration testing, and risk management. - Mastering Code & Development: Code snippets, tutorials, and solutions for common programming challenges. - Cloud Computing & Scalability: Insights into AWS, serverless computing, and cloud security. - GitHub Mastery & DevOps: Guides on version control, GitHub Actions, and repository management. - AI & Machine Learning Innovations: Machine learning, deep learning, and AI-related projects.




AWS Security Automation (View Project) - Implemented AWS Lambda, API Gateway, and Security Hub for real-time security analysis.
Insider Threat Detection (View Project) - Built ML-based risk assessment using TensorFlow and Scikit Learn.
IoT Smart System (View Project) - Designed IoT applications with AWS cloud connectivity.





Deep Learning Week Hackathon (2022) - Led AI solution for real-time pedestrian and vehicle detection.
Lyve Cloud Hackathon (2022) - Developed cloud-based media streaming server.




Feel free to connect with me on: - üìß Email: haiyang.xu.2021@scis.smu.edu.sg - üîó LinkedIn - üêô GitHub


‚ÄúTechnology is best when it brings people together.‚Äù ‚Äì Matt Mullenweg

title: 20 Useful ChatGPT Commands for Research & Productivity
text:
Below is a list of 20 commands (prompt techniques) you can use with ChatGPT to improve your research and work productivity. Each command includes a brief explanation and a copyable prompt.


Prompt:
Summarize the following text: [insert text]  
Explanation: Quickly distills lengthy articles or reports into a concise summary.



Prompt:
Explain [concept] like I‚Äôm 5.  
Explanation: Breaks down complex topics into simple, easy-to-understand language.



Prompt:
Act as a [research assistant/expert in renewable energy/etc.].  
Explanation: Guides ChatGPT to respond in the tone and style of a specified expert.



Prompt:
Generate an outline for a report on [topic].  
Explanation: Creates a structured blueprint for projects, articles, or presentations.



Prompt:
List the pros and cons of [subject].  
Explanation: Helps evaluate options by comparing benefits and drawbacks.



Prompt:
Compare [option A] and [option B].  
Explanation: Provides a side-by-side comparison for decision-making.



Prompt:
Translate the following text to [language]: [insert text].  
Explanation: Converts text into different languages, aiding localization.



Prompt:
Rewrite this text in simpler language: [insert text].  
Explanation: Makes technical or dense content more accessible.



Prompt:
Brainstorm creative ideas for [project/topic].  
Explanation: Generates innovative ideas to overcome creative blocks.



Prompt:
Give me a step-by-step guide on how to [task].  
Explanation: Breaks down tasks into clear, actionable steps.



Prompt:
Give me synonyms for [word].  
Explanation: Helps find alternative words for better phrasing.



Prompt:
Explain this code: [insert code].  
Explanation: Breaks down and explains code snippets in simple terms.



Prompt:
Find and fix errors in this code: [insert code].  
Explanation: Identifies and corrects errors in programming code.



Prompt:
Generate a sample paragraph about [topic].  
Explanation: Creates placeholder or draft text for various needs.



Prompt:
Create a study plan for learning [subject] in [timeframe].  
Explanation: Helps organize study schedules effectively.



Prompt:
Extract the key points from this text: [insert text].  
Explanation: Pulls out essential details from dense information.



Prompt:
Create a to-do list for [goal/project].  
Explanation: Structures tasks efficiently for productivity.



Prompt:
Convert this text to bullet points: [insert text].  
Explanation: Reformats text into easier-to-read structures.



Prompt:
Summarize the major events of [historical period].  
Explanation: Provides concise historical overviews.



Prompt:
Write a professional email for [purpose].  
Explanation: Creates well-structured emails for professional use.
